body:
I'd rather have the more explicit:

``` java
void foo(@Header("Auth-Token") String token, ..);
```

myself. A `null` value would omit the header.

This would also allow for things like cache control which have been requested before.

+1 

so `Header` is already taken.. how about `HeaderParam`?

warning: `@HeaderParam` sounds similar to `@QueryParam`, but it would target parameters not the method.

Do you think making `@HeaderParam` is ok considering this?
We could rename the existing `Header` to `HeaderPair` since it's rarely interacted with.
fine by me.  I'll take this on unless you'd prefer to.
Go for it. I'm going to do a refactor around the over-usage of `@Name`.
sgtm that's easier to implement, too
you wouldn't happen to have an eclipse formatter, would you?
No, we're basically 100% IntelliJ IDEA. Two-space indents and `@Overrides` on the same line as the method should get you 99% of the way.

issue.title: add new @Headers and @Header annotations

body: This needs to make it into the documentation; very useful.

issue.body: As promised, I have added documentation about Header Manipulation to the website after getting a speedy response. Proof for needing this on the home page can be found in issue #316, #198, and #146
